title: DoYou Yoga & Fitness: Cross-Platform Redesign & React Migration
problemStatement: Platform built on deprecated mobile framework requiring complete technology migration to React/React Native ecosystem.
Poor visual hierarchy and overwhelming choice architecture in 'Challenges' section caused decision paralysis, while complex 5-step enrollment flow created friction in user onboarding.
Inconsistent design system with outdated aesthetic didn't reflect DoYou's wellness-focused brand identity or meet accessibility standards.
Missing gamification and feedback mechanisms resulted in low daily engagement and poor habit formation among users.
solutions: Collaborated with development team to assess and implement React/React Native migration strategy, ensuring scalable cross-platform foundation for web, iOS, and Android.
Redesigned information architecture with card-based categorization system and streamlined enrollment flow from 5 steps to 2, removing unnecessary decision points.
Developed comprehensive design system with WCAG AA-compliant color palette, reusable components, and consistent spacing rules that mapped directly to React components.
Designed milestone and streak gamification system with immediate visual feedback, validated through usability testing with 15+ users and daily dogfooding of production builds.
results: Successfully migrated entire platform from deprecated framework to scalable React/React Native ecosystem.
Established design system with 100% adoption across all platforms, ensuring visual consistency and accelerating future development.
Reduced enrollment friction by 60%, streamlining onboarding flow from 5 clicks to 2.
Reduced cognitive load in challenge discovery, enabling users to make faster, more confident decisions.

metrics.label: Platform Rating
metrics.description: Average user satisfaction across web, iOS, and Android.

metrics.label: Design System Coverage
metrics.description: Consistent implementation across platforms from iOS to Android, and web.

title: CSU Dashboard Redesign: Laravel Migration & Design System Implementation
problemStatement: Legacy dashboard system built on outdated PHP framework with inconsistent design patterns across high school and community college versions, creating maintenance overhead and poor user experience.
Platform existed in isolation from CSU's main ecosystem, using different authentication methods and data structures, preventing seamless integration with campus systems.
Outdated and inconsistent data sources made it difficult for educators, students, and parents to access reliable CSU campus statistics for informed enrollment decisions.
Lack of unified component library led to visual inconsistencies across dashboards, with each serving different audiences but requiring duplicate effort for similar features.
solutions: Architected and led migration from legacy PHP to modern Laravel framework with Vue.js components, implementing MVC architecture with repository pattern and dependency injection for maintainable codebase.
Integrated dashboards with CSU's authentication system and unified data sources, implementing secure REST APIs with CSRF protection, role-based access control, and rate limiting.
Designed and built reusable component library with Bootstrap and Sass, establishing design system standards that reduced code duplication by 40% and ensured visual consistency.
Optimized MySQL database performance through strategic indexing and Eloquent ORM implementation, managing schema migrations to ensure data integrity across 23 campuses.
results: Successfully migrated both high school and community college dashboards to Laravel, serving 10,000+ educators, students, and parents across California with reliable CSU campus statistics.
Reduced code duplication by 40% through reusable component library, accelerating feature development and simplifying maintenance across dashboard variants.
Integrated dashboards into CSU ecosystem with unified authentication and data sources, improving data accuracy and user experience.
Improved database query performance and established scalable architecture supporting 23 CSU campuses statewide.

metrics.label: Active Users
metrics.description: Educators, students, and parents using dashboards across California.

metrics.label: Code Efficiency
metrics.description: Less code duplication through component library.
